pages.text: Most machines in the mod will use $(thing)Hot Air$() as their fuel. $(thing)Hot Air$() can be produced with $(thing)Aeroheaters$(), which will output their $(thing)Hot Air$() to the block above them.$(br2)$(thing)Hot Air$() always travels upwards and is lost when going through anything that does not let it pass.

$(thing)Hot Air machines$() will require $(thing)Hot Air$() to be supplied to their bottom side at a certain temperature in order to work.$(br2)They will also transmit their $(thing)Hot Air$() up, with a lowered temperature while working. This allows you to power several machines with the same $(thing)Aeroheater$() by stacking them on top of eachother.

Higher temperatures will result in machines working faster. For example, supplying a machine with twice its required temperature will cause it to work twice as fast.$(br2)It also indirectly allows you to stack more machines since the temperature can go through a lot more working machines before being too low to be usable.

$(item)Air Funnels$() allow you to transfer $(thing)Hot Air$() along longer distances without having to make expensive machines.$(br)In addition, they will stop transmitting $(thing)Hot Air$() when supplied with a redstone signal.
